intro: Tanarius velutinus, commonly known as the velvetleaf tanarius, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Tanarius velutinus is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance.
